unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_pro01_lor.text: As battle-hardened as he is ancient, the White Dwarf will always stand his ground, no matter the pandemonium unfolding around him.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_he.text: "Stand Back! These are Dawr, but this is only the milluzth attempt!"

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_un.text: Some drowned sailors lurch from the sea swollen with noxious gases, ready to explode upon contact with enemy blades. Keep well back!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_unit.text: Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the Winds from whence they came.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: Tendrils of solidified darkness writhe outwards, draining the lifeforce from foes and renewing the caster’s own vigour.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc06_lor.text: Wurrzag inflicts a cloud of confusion upon his enemies, whose words ring hollow and spells fly false.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: For those that know its secrets, the forest can be a highly advantageous place in which to fight.\\n\\n[[col:magic]]This ability is being mirrored using knowledge gained from a prisoner interrogation in Athel Tamarha.[[/col]]

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_ban.text: Those who go to battle with the Everqueen's personally hand-woven banner do so proudly, and never waver.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_item.text: A shard of blackest night said to be a prison for the partial essence of the Trickster himself. Any close to it may be undone by its troubling aura.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: "He who runs away lives to fight another day!" – so the foul, craven adage goes.\\n\\n[[col:magic]]This ability is being mirrored using knowledge gained from a prisoner interrogation in Athel Tamarha.[[/col]]

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_spe.text: At the spellcaster's command, nebulous nature spirits assail the foe, clawing with hands not nearly as insubstantial as they first appear.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_item.text: Asavar Kul, the Butcher of Praag, demanded his Champions sup boiled Daemon blood from the Chalice of Chaos, imbuing them with strength and vigour.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_qu.text: Conjured by a Bright Wizard or Chaos Sorcerer, a column of churning fire erupts from the battlefield, causing much destruction!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: Like a pregnant boil bursting forth, the ground bursts open and pus-coated Plague Monks emerge to do battle at the verminous summoner’s bidding.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_ite.text: Each egg contains deadly spiderlings, to swarm over and bite the foe's body, injecting deadly venom into the wounds.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: Friendly targets are filled with magical energy, making them even more aggressive!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_qu.text: As the Warpstone sparks, man becomes beast, overcome by an insatiable, animalistic hunger.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: The Shaman points a bony finger at a nearby enemy, cursing them in the name of Gork.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_spe.text: Calling upon the beast-spirits of the wild, the caster sheathes vulnerable flesh in unyielding fur and hide.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_weap.text: The Axe of Dargo, a runic weapon of monstrous size, is tempered with dragon's blood and iron-oaths of vengeance.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_un.text: Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the winds from whence they came.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: Green bolts of purest spite burst forth from the Shaman and streak towards the enemy.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_it.text: No purer sound is there than a single note from this great horn, capable of emboldening the faint of heart and rousing the timid.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_he.text: Troll Hags eat anything that finds its way into their swamps, be it alive, dead, or horribly decomposed. Their putrid breath is certainly testament to that!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_spe.text: Prickly gorse bursts from the ground around the caster's allies, protecting them from attack like a spiky, living shield.

unit_abilities_onscreen_name_wh2_dlc17_h.text: Something Wicked This Way Comes Upgraded

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_fac.text: Once enough blood has been shed, the Dark Elves’ murderous prowess increases, as if Khaine himself was guiding his disciples' blades!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_bann.text: The Banner of Rage flutters and growls in the wind. This standard imbues those who walk under it with an anger that can only be sated with enemy deaths!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: Spirits of the departed assail the Wizard’s foes, sapping their resolve and causing dread among their numbers.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: The Phoenix's spiralling dive whips the Winds of Magic into a swirling vortex of magical flame.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_ite.text: When blown, the Great Horn calls up a thunderstorm which forces the bearer's enemies back with high winds and lightning strikes.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_ban.text: A jagged spike with the corroded remains of armoured warriors impaled; this totem spreads an aura of entropy.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_ar.text: A bombardment of unearthly projectiles; a storm that's extremely hard to weather.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_lor.text: The Despairs are among the most feared Spites within Athel Loren, their arrival always foretelling imminent death.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_lo.text: Imrik’s affinity with Dragons gifts him their sharpness; with his concentration heightened, even the most skilful foes struggle to land blows.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_lo.text: From the Dammaz Kron, the High King recounts an ancestral grudge towards the foe, driving the Dawi into a vengeful rage.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_pro03_uni.text: Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time before disappearing back to the Winds from whence they came.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_un.text: Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, eventually disappearing back to the Winds from whence they came.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: The enemy target's armour begins to rust, disappearing in clouds of tiny flakes and weakening his defensive abilities.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_un.text: The Dark Magic that holds these subjects together has failed. As the necromantic energy flows out of them, nothing is left but a pile of iron and bones in the sand.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_ite.text: The impossibly-harsh climate in which the Frost-Wyrms live ensures their scales bolster armour's effectiveness whilst burning any foe who touches them with intense cold.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: As the caster utters a forbidden name, their enemies are wracked with waves of agony.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_it.text: Concentrated within a single acorn of the Mighty Oak is the potential for an instant and devastating release of explosive magical power.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_unit.text: All the sons of Grungni can dig-in, enabling them to better resist physical attacks from the foe. Any missile attacks they can make are also improved.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_ar.text: placeholder

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_ch.text: Copious amounts of food constantly bubbles and brews in Grom’s astringent stomach bile, causing horrendous and explosive belching that he can barely control.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_uni.text: As the blood in the cauldron boils and bubbles, Khaine drives bloodlust to a fever pitch and stokes hearts with a violent fire.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_pro01_ite.text: Long thought lost to time and conflict, Grombrindal's awesome helm inspires already-courageous Dwarfen hearts to even greater acts of bravery.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc04_spe.text: The once-proud Strigoi now dwell in dank recesses, binding foul, crypt-dwelling scavengers to their inexorable will.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_char.text: Vampires have long had a savage and unstoppable bloodlust. They will continue to slaughter until their enemies lie dead at their feet, or have been turned to Undeath.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: "Y'see that glowin' spot there?"\\n"Ye."\\n"Poke it."\\nPHTWOOSH!!!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_hero.text: Night Goblin Shamans brew a pungent fungus potion that, when drunk, will send the Fanatics into a spinning, whirling cyclone of death!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_spe.text: Sounding a gnarled horn, the caster summons a glowing amber spear and hurls it at the foe with uncanny accuracy.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_spe.text: Prickly gorse bursts from the ground around the caster's allies, protecting them from attack like a spiky, living shield.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_sp.text: Tendrils of solidified darkness writhe outwards, draining the lifeforce from foes and renewing the caster’s own vigour.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: Being a towering, walking cluster of rocks means that big bits sometimes fall off you, much to the detriment of anything smaller nearby!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_lor.text: These warriors have something of an anger management problem. Funnily enough, no one has yet found a safe way to broach the issue.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_ar.text: "Now that we have the ocean so slow, put the sails away and prepare to row; for the monster hunts and its prey should shiver, ever since the Vortex went a-quiver!"

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_spe.text: Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_ar.text: "Anchor the tides and slow the moons, becalm the waters for some hidden boons. Break the waves, tame the sea; how big can one beast be?"

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_sp.text: Sword-blows are mysteriously turned away as Ptra's wife reaches out to shield Nehekhara's warriors from evil.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_it.text: This magical staff was plucked from the clutches of the Vampire Mandregan; it enables its bearer to channel the Winds of Magic to his whim.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_lo.text: Death is no obstacle to those with unalterable, unassailable determination.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_we.text: Having deprived the biggest and the worst of its life, this blade hungers for other monstrous opponents worthy of its bite.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc04_uni.text: This depraved artefact, when held aloft, restores energy to those who swear fealty to its vileness.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc07_her.text: If you are in his sight you are marked for death from that moment on; your remaining breaths are a mere formality.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_spe.text: A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_sp.text: "They'll never know how many we are in this fog… Attack!"

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_ar.text: Morrslieb's whispers can drive Beastmen into a terrifying frenzy, the power of which few can survive.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_spe.text: The Bray-Shaman drives a spear of wrath into enemy hearts, unlocking the beast within and causing them to turn against their own.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_ar.text: This is never directly seen or controlled by the player.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: A foul mist wraps around the weapons of an allied pack, their blades dripping with noxious filth.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc14_un.text: Warp-energy channelled directly into the ground causes the earth to tremble at a frequency that causes brains to rattle within skulls and bones to splinter!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_ar.text: The great god Itzl is the three-horned ruler of all coldbloods; only those blessed in His sight may achieve mastery over his mighty, horned servants.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_uni.text: Some creatures, such as the Phoenix, are infused with magic and use the arcane Winds to fly upon and immerse themselves in.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: The Alchemist conjures a gaudy cloak of shimmering scale to improve his allies’ defensive stance.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc14_un.text: Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the Winds from whence they came.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: The spirits of ancient warriors are summoned and lend their might to allies in the present.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_cha.text: When a bomb is smashed, a dark smoke curls out, concealing those who wish to hide and choking everyone else.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_arm.text: ph

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_we.text: One of twelve magical swords belonging to the Empire's Elector Counts, 'Crow Feeder' leaves its prey - often the marauding Norscans - as nothing but so much carrion.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_uni.text: What beauty and violence there is in the dance? A flurry of blades and a certain savagery of intent...

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_sp.text: By speaking Druthandor's name the Wizard is able to heal allies' injuries much faster than by natural means.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_ch.text: As a battlefield surgeon of great repute, Hertwig is able to swiftly dress the wounds of targeted friendly units, restoring their health.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_ch.text: The essence of the Jackal-headed God imbues the bearer's weapons with an insatiable hunger for the souls of the living.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: Bellowing a war cry into the air, the mighty Waaagh! is unleashed – da ladz echo the terrifying roar in a crescendo of murderous hysteria!\\n\\n[[col:magic]]This ability is being mirrored using knowledge gained from a prisoner interrogation in Athel Tamarha.[[/col]]

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_her.text: The herd charges out, slathering jaws and bellowing in fury. Against the charge, none can stand.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_arm.text: On the battlefield, Clan Mors' sacred Warpstones instil their upstart warriors with even greater stamina and skill.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: Shadows be thy cloak and darkness thy ally.\\n\\n[[col:magic]]This ability is being mirrored using knowledge gained from a prisoner interrogation in Athel Tamarha.[[/col]]

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc06_wea.text: Covered in magical glyphs, this staff protects Wurrzag from the many magical machinations ranged against him.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_unit.text: Such champions are adept at delivering a Killing Blow, depriving the foe of life with a single, powerful attack.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: Reaching into the Wind of Hysh, the Wizard draws forth ennobling energies to steady faint hearts - augmenting allies with courage.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_it.text: This amulet wreathes its wearer in a mystical flame that burns magic instead of flesh.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_char.text: Those with such skills can evade enemy attacks with ease and break from combat, should they feel that it is tactically important to do so.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_ch.text: He hits the ground with such force that anyone nearby is shaken to their very core!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_he.text: "Where's that powder monkey? Get him up 'ere now!"

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc12_ar.text: This dread projectile causes an enormous explosion on impact, sending entire units - and no doubt their limbs - flying off in all directions.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_un.text: One too many Warp-fuel infusions have made the Hellion a volatile mutant indeed, allowing it to spontaneously discharge destructive magical vortices at will.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: The spellcaster opens a vortex leading into the Pit. Anything caught within it will be lost forever.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_qu.text: "Cross your fingers, or whatever you have instead – I’m not entirely sure what this one will do!"

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_he.text: The presence of the Dark Omen is an awful thing that saps the foe's will to fight on.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_un.text: Their lances gleam with such luminosity that the foe cannot see to adequately defend themselves against the Templars' devastating charge.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_pro08_we.text: Felix Jaeger recovered the Rune Sword Karaghul, a blade with a dragon hilt, from a fallen Knight of the Fiery Heart deep within Karak Eight Peaks.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_it.text: Symbol of the true ruler of Nagarythe, the Shadow Crown is a simple silver circlet set with a single diamond.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_ite.text: This battered suit of ramshackle plate mail is covered with the soot from man's burned palaces and temples.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc07_lor.text: The unearthly vapour moves around the foe, in between and inside – those found wanting are scarred by the Lady’s enchanted touch.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_ar.text: Bellowing a war cry into the air, the mighty Waaagh! is unleashed – da boyz echo the terrifying roar in a crescendo of murderous hysteria!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_lor.text: Amber is the colour of beasts. Such magic can ensnare and entrap animals much more easily than so-called "intelligent" species.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_lo.text: This traditional trapper's tool is a noose made from wire; if the foe struggles, it simply tightens, cutting into the flesh.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_spe.text: At the spellcaster's command, nebulous nature spirits assail the foe, clawing with hands not nearly as insubstantial as they first appear.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_ite.text: All those who seek the favour of Loec wear a simple-looking pendant of silver that actually conceals great power.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_sp.text: Imbued with the essence of the God of Death, the Nehekharans' blades strike with supernatural force to harvest souls for Djaf.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_weap.text: This powerful heirloom was forged from the finest Bretonnian silverline. It catches the suns rays and magnifies them, dazzling Louen's enemies as he makes the death stroke.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_uni.text: When the Dark Gods bless the faithful assembled from atop their mighty battle-altars, loyalty is assured forevermore.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_sp.text: Gesticulating wildly, the caster gifts an allied unit with a rabid, frothing need to attack and consume the foe!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_ch.text: Radiants are sponges for magical energy, manifesting as little more than blurred shapes of pure light that beckon the Winds to their host.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_ar.text: Da boyz could never outdo Grimgor’s lust for carnage, though whenever he calls for a Waaagh! they always try.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_arm.text: A base, strategically-positioned nearby, ensures that these exceptionally-powerful, exceedingly-loyal birds can join their Elven allies at a moment's notice.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_spe.text: The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: Grom keeps da ladz riled up by keeping them as well fed as he; his big Waaagh! doesn’t fight on an empty stomach!\\n\\n[[col:magic]]This ability is being mirrored using knowledge gained from a prisoner interrogation in Athel Tamarha.[[/col]]

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc07_uni.text: Unit forms into a flying wedge shape for good penetration when charging, but slightly slower movement speed.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_cha.text: Distilled from the blood of Hag Queens, this evil brew drives imbibers into an ecstasy of destruction.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_char.text: To rally the troops and bring them back to the fore takes strong leadership skills and an iron will.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_ite.text: A magnificent shield emblazoned with a coiled serpent, allowing its wielder to benefit from even greater protection.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_lor.text: Like Teclis before them, the deepest blue of night imbues the drinker with the stamina and strength they need to face down the foe.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc14_we.text: When first she faced Chaos, Repanse broke open the reliquary of the village Grail Chapel and took up the ancient sword she found there.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_fi.text: Massively reduce enemy Lords' melee defence in Final Battle

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_item.text: Eating a seed from this small Troll-skin leather pouch will imbue the consumer with regenerative abilities.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_sp.text: A whirlwind of skulls tears across the battlefield, devouring all in its path in the Goddess of the Green Moon's bitter, vindictive name.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_spe.text: The Wizard unleashes a hail of magical energy, transmuting his foes into Unliving golden statues.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: The caster intones the dread syllables once uttered by Nagash, restoring friendly targets.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_lo.text: A violent vortex that whips up a cloud of razor-sharp desert sand to lacerate and consume the foe.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_uni.text: Just give the order and the Hydra's heads will spew forth their fiery breath, each competing for the brightest flame.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_lo.text: Drycha’s soul eternally seethes, her external wounds only further fuelling her vindictive, murderous intent.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_uni.text: The youngest Dragons have a warm hue to their scales and a fiery temper, with scorching breath to match.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_ite.text: Hewn from the same rock that forms the Waystones, the Vortex Shard has the power to becalm the Winds of Magic.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_ban.text: Though tattered and ancient, this banner causes forces to charge - in the name of the Hunt - before the main Elven host.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_arm.text: ph

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_qu.text: This Hydra head is used to heal instead of harm, causing an explosion of magical energy that restores its target’s health.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_pro08_ch.text: Despite involving himself in the most dangerous situations imaginable, and against the Slayer's suicidally-brave will, Gotrek is made of sterner stuff even than others of his kind and can survive any hand-to-hand encounter.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: Projecting violence in a mental wave, the Shaman glowers at his target and lets loose a bolt of brain-melting force.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_item.text: This marble and golden-laced artefact can summon the Winds of Magic, but at a cost to the user.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: If but one more would strike down our every foe, then we shall let loose once again!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc04_spe.text: The once-proud Strigoi now dwell in dank recesses, binding foul, crypt-dwelling scavengers to their inexorable will.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_it.text: Bow down before the true Lord of the Sea.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc04_spe.text: Creatures of the dark beware, for the Mage casts a ball of pure light to banish enemies of White Wizardry.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: The Liche Priests use the very breath of Nehekhara’s gods to reach into the Realm of Souls, retrieving the spirits of dead soldiers for binding and eternal service to their Tomb King’s will.\\n\\n[[col:magic]]This ability is being mirrored using knowledge gained from a prisoner interrogation in Athel Tamarha.[[/col]]

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_it.text: The simple clay vessel may not look like much, but the High Priest's Undying essence within can thwart sorcery and strengthen incantations.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_lo.text: By the bellow of an angry Warboss, there’s always that little bit more murderousness to be squeezed from the boys.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_arm.text: A surge of crackling energy and shimmering light heralds a blast of magic, as the power of the Vortex explodes into the world.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_ite.text: Wrapped in a cloak of grey, the wearer becomes insubstantial and highly-protected against magical attacks.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc04_uni.text: Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the winds from whence they came.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_ite.text: This ancient suit of chainmail can counter the fanciful enchantments and magicks of enemy blades.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_lo.text: At the most opportune moment, arrows are willed to fly fast and true by the very wood from which they are carved.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc14_sp.text: Deftly conjured and swiftly flung, the Skaven's fiendish Warp throwing-stars are, like all their weird scientific advances, explicitly designed to cause maximum death.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: This gnarled stave is carved from the blackened heartwood of a Hangman's Tree. It contains a powerful spell that fills nearby Undead with a frantic vitality.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_uni.text: When going berserk, savage, barely-controllable warriors become savage, completely-uncontrollable warriors; best keep your distance!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_ar.text: The Mistwalkers of Yvresse are called upon to defend the homeland in its hour of need.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_un.text: Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, eventually disappearing back to the Winds from whence they came.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_lo.text: The heavenly fire of Ptra's rage, directed at those who dare stand against his servants.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_we.text: With just the lightest exhalation, this golden instrument of death blasts forth a hail of murderous darts.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_ch.text: Shrikes take on various frightening forms, moving like quicksilver to target the eyes, and even enter foes’ bodies to attack their very minds.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_un.text: A sudden discharge of highly concentrated acid douses everyone nearby, melting away armour and burning skin.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: Bolts of cleansing energy fly from the spellcaster's hands, searing evil wherever they strike.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: The lurid fungus strapped to the front of this Pump Wagon explodes with immense force on contact with the enemy – much to the amusement of its Snotling crew!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_he.text: Summoned forth from filth-ridden sewers, disease-carrying amalgamations of rat and wolf cause pestilent havoc in the enemy’s ranks.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: The caster draws on unstable power from the Realm of Chaos to charge their spells.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_weap.text: The battered Helm of Discord is a bronze helmet covered in withering symbols that both distract and unsettle any attacker.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc12_sp.text: Mighty Lord Kroak spawns a small sun that, when it explodes, causes abject devastation… funnily enough.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_wea.text: Woven from the hair of Witch Elves and studded with Harpy fangs; a victim caught in the Web will be ripped apart.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_lo.text: With stealth capabilities honed in the Realm of Chaos, Oxyotl’s skill at tracking and stalking his targets is unparalleled.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc14_fi.text: As a follower of the Trickster God, Loec, the Shadow King is a master of deception and distraction.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_lo.text: Bears, Orcs, Kroxigor - prey-size is not a hindrance to the master hunter.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc06_uni.text: Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the winds from whence they came.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc01_ite.text: An ancient battle-helm dating back to the time of Morkar, it exudes an aura of raw malice to cow the servants of Chaos.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_rune.text: Groth One-Eye first struck this rune in the time of Kurgan Ironbeard, when the Greenskins were driven from the Badlands and the Dwarfs prospered.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: A battle prayer that bathes the Warrior Priest in white, holy fire, sears Sigmar’s foes but leaves the supplicant unharmed.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_que.text: "PHHHHHHHHHRRRRRRRRRRRRRRTT!!! By the Gods! You can smell the sulphur comin' off that one!"

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_lor.text: Hatred is an energy source just like any other, to be harnessed and directed at will.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_arm.text: Deceit and fell-plots abound within the dark walls of Anlec. As such, the city's innate Dark Magic imbues those tasked with its defence.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_un.text: This horrid creature bleeds stinking, vitriolic bile that spurts out from the slightest wound in great gouts of hissing back fluid.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: The Skaven caster disappears in a puff of greenish smoke, only to reappear elsewhere on the battlefield.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc14_un.text: Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the Winds from whence they came.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_it.text: A thick ring of oathgold, created using words of fury once spoken by Grimnir himself.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: The Wizard calls forth spectral winds that howl through the enemy ranks, tearing their souls from their bodies.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc14_it.text: Woven from stolen human hair and spider silk, the cloak both conceals and silences the wearer, making Snikch near invisible in darkness.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_it.text: The desert itself shall be your coat... and the foe's undoing.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc14_lo.text: The startling crack of the Beastmaster’s hefty and ever-so-slightly serrated whip of Dragon-sinew suitably infuriates the beasts for battle.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_lo.text: These arrows will kill of course, but are mainly used to cause a disorientating, explosive spectacle to unnerve the enemy.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_ch.text: The Asp Goddess healing touch floods Khalida's body, permeating the husk of her corpse and snapping her back to vital, vengeful Unlife.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_lo.text: A brutally simple weapon makes the Doombull’s incredible punching power more than enough to puncture armour and cause dreadful injury.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_ite.text: Loec the Trickster‘s aid comes at a price. His talisman is strange - a bracelet of two interlocking halves.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_weap.text: Such is the shine upon every scale in this resplendent mail that the foe can't help but be dazzled.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_ar.text: The servants of the Warrior-God – his chosen ones – live for war's struggle and glory.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_he.text: Once consumed by Loec’s aspect, one can instinctively evade attack through trickery, mimicking his deception of the Dark Gods.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_arm.text: Is it science? Be it sorcery? Whatever it is, Clan Skryre's harnessing of blest-Warpstone degrades the foe's magical resistance to nil.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_sp.text: Prickly gorse bursts from the ground around the caster's allies, protecting them from attack like a spiky, living shield.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_arm.text: As the Corsairs invoke the Bloody-handed God, fell lightning arcs from the sky; it is the lash of Khaine upon the souls of the enemy.

unit_abilities_onscreen_name_wh_main_spe.text: Curse of the Midnight Wind Upgraded

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_ar.text: Starting off as distant, irritating shrieks, the terror soon becomes real – these suicidal Goblins have been granted the honour of personally delivering death to the enemy!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: With a chilling howl, the Shaman summons a great pale moon with a leering goblinoid face and large, tusk-like fangs.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_uni.text: Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the Winds from whence they came.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_lor.text: To summon the essence of Chaos is to unleash its Ruinous fury upon any and all who witness it.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc06_run.text: The Rune of Hearth & Home stirs a Dwarf's pride in his noble Hold, Clan and Ancestors.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_wea.text: Gifted to Ulanor of the seaguard by King Finubar, this bow was created from a single piece of rare silverwood.
The Hydra Blade was carved from a single fang of Akholrak, first and greatest of the War Hydras broken by Malekith.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: Quite literally the cut-and-thrust of the Elven way of battle; every stroke is precisely made and finds its mark perfectly.\\n\\n[[col:magic]]This ability is being mirrored using knowledge gained from a prisoner interrogation in Athel Tamarha.[[/col]]

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: Focusing all his mystical might, the Pyromancer strikes the foe with a flurry of incandescent missiles.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_que.text: The lame Beastlord is poisoned! The beast weakens - now is the time to strike!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_it.text: One sip of the elixir fills the body of its drinker with the strength of many powerful, elite warriors.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: The Lady's blessing is a wondrous gift freely graced upon all Bretonnian subjects, should they but kneel and utter their devotion.\\n\\n[[col:magic]]This ability is being mirrored using knowledge gained from a prisoner interrogation in Athel Tamarha.[[/col]]

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: Bolts of Dark Magic leap from the caster’s eyes, withering flesh and blackening the bone beneath.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_spe.text: A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_un.text: Becoming more savage and frenzied the greater the scent and sight of blood.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: The Wizard ensorcels allied weapons, making them burn with a savage fire. The targets of the spell are augmented with superior flaming blades.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_pro03_lor.text: The Lichemaster raises the ancient Wight to do his bidding, but Krell serves Nagash first and foremost...

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_ite.text: This string of beaded shells, feathers and bones is a charm that surrounds the warrior in a miasma of colour.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc04_spe.text: Helman Ghorst, the maudlin Necromancer, uses his dark knowledge of the black arts to raise the dead and bring them under his control.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_ite.text: Made from the skull of a geomancer - when filled with soil, the chalice can summon a deluge of blood-soaked mud.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_wea.text: Although King Torgald's blade is a prized trophy, it is also an eternal reminder of the consequences of grand proclamations afore the Gods.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_we.text: The deadly Moonbow was handed to Alith Anar by the goddess Lileath herself.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc04_ite.text: This decrepit tome bristles with dark secrets and eldritch powers. Reading from it summons dark thoughts and grim deeds.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_twa03_lo.text: The greatest Beastlord of Naggaroth is an ice-cold presence, his mere proximity triggering his beasts’ instincts to meekly obey his every command.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_we.text: All Dawi that witness the Ironwarden wielding this mighty hammer in action will be roused to war.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: The Skaven utters a vile phrase and belches forth an impossibly foul cloud.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_wea.text: Made to fell the Mammuts of the far north, this spear bears enchantments that allow it to penetrate deep into flesh.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_uni.text: When under pressure, the primal instincts of these natural predators take over - they may then go on a rampage against nearby enemy units, attacking the closest one and ignoring any orders given.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_it.text: Dwarfs excel at crafting lenses, making their spy-glasses the envy of all umgi, except Elves, the gits.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_sp.text: Ghorok was a legendary Minotaur, ferocious as a storm. His spirit-mantle is terrible but dangerous to the bearer.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_sp.text: Imbued with the essence of the God of Death, the Nehekharans' blades strike with supernatural force to harvest souls for Djaf.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_it.text: Fuelled by pure insanity and the arcane magic hoarded in Blacktoof’s lifetime, a stone totem akin to the Greenskin gods themselves is manifested.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_sp.text: The Bray-Shaman sends his mind winging into the wilds to possess a Cygor, then summons it to the battlefield.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc06_lor.text: The terrifying visage painted upon Wurrzag affects enemies' concentration, allowing him to take full advantage of their confusion!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_it.text: A dozen Kroxigor were needed to haul this matchless shield to the mainland and generations of Skink artisans laboured to carve it.
Hertwig uses the amulet to boost his lifeforce at the point of death, which pulls him back from the very brink of oblivion.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_it.text: Thorek’s self-crafted armour can turn a Giant’s club, allowing the Runelord to walk unscathed through the flames of the Wyrm Drakamol.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: Fingers of light seep into enemy armour, attacking its wearers.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_ban.text: This ancient banner has the power to wrack the sky with storms, tearing the heavens apart with its fury.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_ar.text: Beastmen raids are accompanied by wild, inhuman sounds that leave defenders staggered and vulnerable.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: Skaven are craven by nature, but take courage when in packs of their own kind, where they move slower but enjoy the safety of numbers.\\n\\n[[col:magic]]This ability is being mirrored using knowledge gained from a prisoner interrogation in Athel Tamarha.[[/col]]

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_sp.text: A whirlwind of skulls tears across the battlefield, devouring all in its path in the Goddess of the Green Moon's bitter, vindictive name.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_uni.text: Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the Winds from whence they came.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: A wave of green energy emanates outwards, forming a shockwave of power that assaults any unfortunate foe.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc14_sp.text: Green ribbons of Warp-Energy tear the flesh from the target’s bones. It's very nasty to behold – as nasty as it sounds, in fact – but far nastier, of course, if you're the recipient…

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc12_lo.text: This magical rock causes a rather large explosion that stuns enemies, slowing them down for the kill.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_sp.text: The sky opens and a bolt of burning, pure Chaos black lightning hurtles towards the foe.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_item.text: Volans was the first  Supreme Patriarch, his staff is a symbol of office to any Wizard that now holds that mantle. It also allows the wielder to bend the Winds to his will.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_arm.text: The Plague Monks use their sacred Warpstone to increase the potency of the vile plagues and virulent diseases that are their stock in trade.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_pro04_uni.text: Never make direct eye-contact with a Beastman lest it mark you out for a hideous, flesh-ripping demise.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: Focusing all his mystical might, the Pyromancer strikes the foe with a flurry of incandescent missiles.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_lo.text: Those unfortunates captivated by Loec’s spellbinding dance are drawn inextricably to their doom.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_bann.text: The Griffon Banner was the personal standard of Magnus the Pious; a symbol of Imperial bravery and sacrifice, yet has the opposite effect on enemies ranged before it.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc12_ar.text: This dread projectile causes an enormous explosion on impact, sending entire units - and no doubt their limbs - flying off in all directions.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: A colossal orb of purple-edged darkness materialises - those who do not escape its crystalline touch are doomed for eternity!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_item.text: The skull of the late daemonologist, Katam, continues to jibber in secrets that could drive the listener insane. It knows how to suck the Winds from the enemy.
Originally captured from the Necromancer Kaloth by the Gobbo Shaman Kazgi, the Skull Wand talks in a forgotten dread language and any who hear its words are doomed.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_uni.text: The minds of these warriors are turned over entirely to the defence of the Wildwood; nothing else affects them.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_pro04_uni.text: You really don't want to make them angry. No, *really*.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_lo.text: Should either sister come close to death, the spirit of one flows into the other, thus healing her.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_lo.text: When their backs are broken, strike upon the anvils of their minds. Drive them into the ground, so they never raise a blade to you again.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_wea.text: The paired weapons of Morathi make the Hag Sorceress extremely deadly in combat.
This ancient sword, forged to slay Daemons in the earliest days of Aenarion’s rule, burns with the captured fire of the sun.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_ch.text: It's not running away. It's knowing when and where to be to secure the best advantage.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_un.text: The Empire's dark guardians do not retreat nor surrender, even when faced with seemingly insurmountable odds.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc12_un.text: Visions of the Horned Rat riding a shining Doomwheel into battle overcome the Warp-Grinders, working them into a maniacal frenzy.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_we.text: One of twelve magical swords belonging to the Empire's Elector Counts, 'Brain Wounder' sees almost constant action against the savage Chaos Warbands invading from the desolate, frozen north.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc12_un.text: Sotek's crawling, swarming allies surround the bearer, affording them further might and protection in the struggle to come.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_ch.text: He whose will transcends death can strike out from beyond the grave, to devastating effect.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc06_uni.text: Somewhat surprisingly, even the deadliest Arachnarok feels protective of her brood, and can draw them to her at will.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_spe.text: With a mighty bellow, the spellcaster invokes Corvus the Crow Lord, summoning his servants to peck at the foe's eyes.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_item.text: A staff of pure silver etched with all eight runes from the magic wheel. Such an item can only enhance a Wizard's ability to channel.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_char.text: Such is the power and ferocity of the champion, that those who stand in his way will falter against the warrior's impact.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: A swirling maelstrom of swords spin and slash their way across the battlefield in search of blood.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_we.text: Slagga’s crude twin blades don’t just enable Azhag to enthusiastically slash up anyone who gets close, but also motivate da boyz to follow suit.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: The Wizard infuses his allies with Light Magic, freeing them from the passage of time and speeding up their actions.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_ch.text: Some forms of magical intoxication can cause a mere glare to become more than just a hateful glance across the battlefield.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc04_spe.text: The caster intones the dread syllables once uttered by Nagash, restoring friendly targets.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc07_her.text: Glowing with an uncanny light, each stroke of this sword effortlessly carves the foe clean through.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_ch.text: Cursed to wander the length and breadth of the world, his never-ending quest to challenge and best the most gifted warriors.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc14_lo.text: Tz’arkan’s dark influence waxes and wanes, but when Malus relinquishes control entirely, the Daemon’s supernatural strength is unleashed upon the world.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_uni.text: No one wants to be on the receiving end of these Dragons' fiery breath attack, which surpasses that of their younger kin in both might and enlightenment.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_moun.text: As Hysh gathers and swirls around the Luminark, it creates a becalming eddy that other magical winds struggle to penetrate.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc14_lo.text: Tz’arkan’s dark influence waxes and wanes, but when Malus relinquishes control entirely the Daemon’s supernatural strength is unleashed upon the world.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_un.text: Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, eventually disappearing back to the Winds from whence they came.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_un.text: The laughing warrior-women dance into battle, spinning their blades with a ferocious grace.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_item.text: Upon the Scroll of Shielding is a crude drawing of a warrior's shield displaying an unknown crest of a kingdom long lost.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_hero.text: A quick invocation of protection to Sigmar or Ulric will bless the implorer with a shield of godly faith, should they prove worthy.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc07_lor.text: "I didn't know how empty was my soul... until it was filled."

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_sp.text: The Astromancer seizes the Winds on the battlefield, directing them against the foe to batter targets with unhallowed gales.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_ar.text: placeholder

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_unit.text: As the Gyrocopters speed over the heads of the enemy, their pilots release wing-mounted bombs onto targets below. A click on this button instantly releases one bomb per Gyrocopter.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc12_un.text: Due to the technological advances in Ikit's Forbidden Workshop, this ammunition can never be exhausted!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_it.text: This scroll has a bound spell that, when read, will unleash a sharp blast of arcane light.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc14_sp.text: Shadows solidify around the wearer's body, protecting them from harm while simultaneously making them difficult to see, and therefore incapacitate.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_pro02_ite.text: The life essence of many wretched, innocent smallfolk ensures that those who drink from this cursed cup thrive with newfound power.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_lore.text: Goblin Shamans are sneaky and will steal away the power from the enemy Wizard, cackling maniacally while doing so!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_un.text: The mutated, stitched nightmare roars in pain as a surge of specially concocted Growth Juice courses through its foul body.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_un.text: When you're up to your neck in corpses - and perhaps not all of them are properly dead - it's useful to be able to suppress your natural feelings of fear and dread.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_we.text: Grom’s axe doubles as a can-opener of sorts, prying open a foe’s armour to make mince meat of 'em!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc04_uni.text: The Corpse Cart hardens shattered spirits and emboldens tattered bodies to ever greater acts of violence.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_char.text: The Warrior Priest passes the blessings of the Heldenhammer to the brave men around him.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc01_wea.text: The Auric Armour is a sculpted suit forged from ensorcelled gold. Tendrils of dark energy caress the skin of the wearer, closing his wounds with a tender touch.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_lo.text: A palpable miasma of fell sorcery surrounds the Bray-Shaman, distorting and maiming reality.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_fa.text: The Liche Priests use the very breath of Nehekhara’s gods to reach into the Realm of Souls, retrieving the spirits of dead soldiers for binding and eternal service to their Tomb King’s will.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_ru.text: Runesmiths take particular delight in the sound of the inferior works of other races breaking like icicles beneath a hammer blow.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: As the caster utters a forbidden name, her enemies are wracked with waves of misery.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_ru.text: Invoked only in desperate circumstances, this rune has been devised to keep prized war machines from falling into enemy hands.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_item.text: The Opal Amulet can grant its wearer a life-saving second chance, but suffers a hairline fracture in its previously perfect surface as a result.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_lord.text: The High King is the embodiment of the Karaz Ankor. Should he be wounded or even fall then the Dwarfs will rise in a vengeful rage!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_ban.text: This heavily-woven banner is embroidered with detailed scenes of Elven victories and shines with the light of a thousand gems.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_her.text: Malagor has a dread agenda given unto him by the Dark Gods themselves.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_lo.text: Grimgor’s reputation is one that induces paralysing fear, especially in enemies who find out they have his unwanted attentions on the battlefield!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc14_we.text: With a poisoned sword in both hands and his own tail, few warriors can survive long against the Deathmaster.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_wea.text: This blade, like Durthu himself, is steeped in millennia of bitterness and rage waiting to be unleashed.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_spe.text: Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_spe.text: Spirits of the departed assail the Wizard’s foes, sapping their resolve and causing dread among their numbers.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_arm.text: Wild and untamed, these frightening, aggressive beasts make perfect mounts for those Lizardmen with the skill to ride them.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_que.text: This icy blast freezes and slows the foe, its withering cold hampering their attacks.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_spe.text: The Wizard destroys the foe from within, corroding their minds with doubt and crisis.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: The Curse of the Horned Rat is the dreaded 13th spell - the fabric of reality is torn and the Horned One’s children spill forth!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc06_que.text: Not all Squigs have lasting usefulness. Some have a more fleeting... 'percussive' utility.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_sp.text: As the caster utters a forbidden name, their enemies are wracked with waves of agony.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_cha.text: The Cloven Ones are compelled to seek out ever-greater enemies, whose bodies shall be riven in twain.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: The Wizard extends an ebon hand towards the chosen foe, leeching its spirit through tainted sorcery.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_cha.text: "We feel it. We all feel it. The pull to war. The tug of battle. The NEED to kill."

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc04_spe.text: The Wizard casts an arcane net, created to hold the Great Deceiver himself. Any caught in its strands will struggle to act.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_ar.text: The Sisters’ mighty Forest Dragon thinks nothing of hurling himself into the thick of the fray on their slightest word!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: "These shields are well ‘eavy! Da moment fings get ‘airy, I’s droppin’ it!"

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_uni.text: The Minotaur Lord's blood-lust is infectious - his followers revel in the murder and gore!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_un.text: "He who runs away lives to fight another day!" – so the foul, craven adage goes.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_item.text: The sceptre is an anti-magic totem, vanquishing spellcraft that gets too close to its wielder.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_ch.text: The staring eyes and tattered wings of tiny, glowing Elves befuddle enemy minds, sending them into a sleep-like trance.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_uni.text: Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the Winds from whence they came.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_qu.text: The smell and taste of blood intensifies the rage of most wild creatures – especially Dragons!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc14_un.text: Now you see them, now you don’t… and now you’re seeing double.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: The Shaman throws a black-capped nightshade mushroom into the air, which bursts into a cloud of murky darkness.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_ar.text: The spellcaster calls down a mighty ball of lightning and hurls it - should the foe be struck they will surely be shattered!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_char.text: The Warboss lifts his head and unleashes a mighty "WAAAGH!" – the boyz echo this terrifying roar as the entire Greenskin horde surges towards the enemy!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc07_uni.text: Unit forms into a diamond shape for immense penetration when charging, but very slow movement speed.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_her.text: The raw, corrupted hide of the Skin Wolf, scarred from its many spontaneous transmogrifications, forms a protective, armour-like layer.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_ite.text: Many suits of Dwarfen Gromril have fallen into the clutches of the Skaven. Then they are remade to the ratmen’s liking.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_lo.text: Invoking the Dark Masters who endowed his gift, Taurox’s brazen skin temporarily hardens even further to an impossible rigidity.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc04_ite.text: An ancestral ring, set with a gem of deep, sanguine claret, that has granted the von Carsteins everlasting Undeath.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_mou.text: The swinging of the Great Censer sends a fuming fog of corruption billowing over nearby foes.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_he.text: Arrows, cannonballs and more esoteric munitions are needed in endless supply on the battlefield.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_weap.text: This unsettling weapon spreads a curse on all around, disabusing enemy Warriors of their martial skills.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_it.text: These ornate armour plates are decorated with the likeness of the Scorpion God; his protective energies pervade the very metal used, offering additional protection to the wearer.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_lo.text: The more, the deadlier, the merrier.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_ru.text: The Rune of Slowness hardens the air around those seeking to engage with honest Dwarfen axes.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_ar.text: The great god Itzl is the three-horned ruler of all coldbloods; only those blessed in His sight may achieve mastery over his mighty, horned servants.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_qu.text: Although injured, the mighty Phoenix may still assist its allies, gifting them with the abilities to attack with fire, withstand flames and heal themselves.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc01_wea.text: The gigantic warhammer known as Starcrusher was forged in the raging heart of a volcano. Kholek wields this enormous weapon with staggering brutality and skill despite its size.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_her.text: The herd waits, allowing the enemy to come to them. Nature is their defence, as man will soon find out.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: The caster gestures twitchingly to the skies and fierce gales swirl about, making flight impossible.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc12_un.text: Enemy blades and missiles are easily deflected by the whirling metal, which acts like a defensive barrier when activated.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: Lightning arcs across the battlefield, leaping from foe-to-foe with crackling fury until there are none left within the storm.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_wea.text: From the scattered shards of Har Kaldra was the Chillblade forged. Its touch can freeze body and the soul within.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_lord.text: The Lady's blessing is a wondrous gift freely graced upon all Bretonnian subjects, should they but kneel and utter their devotion.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_sp.text: The Wizard extends an ebon hand towards the chosen foe, leeching its spirit through tainted sorcery.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_it.text: Infused with the sun's dazzling intensity, the power harnessed within gleams brilliantly, blinding the wearer's opponents.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc04_wea.text: This accursed blade drinks deep of its victim's blood, restoring vigour and strength to the one who brandishes it.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_ar.text: Beastmen raids are accompanied by wild, inhuman sounds that leave defenders staggered and vulnerable.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: Upon death, the potent arcane energies of the Phoenix erupt into a magnificent pyre.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_ch.text: "Pale warriors, death-pale were they all; They cried—‘La Belle Dame sans Merci thee hath in thrall!"

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_item.text: The feathers of many beasts dangle from this torc, its enchantments allowing the wearer to strike at flying creatures with savage fury.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_char.text: Necromancers can not only marshal the dead, but leech the power from any souls fleeing their mortal remains.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_qu.text: Those fixed by the Hydra’s commanding gaze find themselves caught in a nightmare of lunacy and delirium.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_it.text: Using a rarefied ore of Gromril, and the finest forging techniques, crafting such mail will make the wearer all but impervious.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_ar.text: "Bring the Barag forwards! Hand me that spyglass!"

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_we.text: Throt’s modified things-catcher makes him an expert throttler, but allows him to excel at throttling things much larger than man-sized!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_ch.text: Several arrows rain down swiftly from the sky, striking anything caught within their area of effect.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: The Wizard ensorcels allied weapons, making them burn with a savage fire. Friendly targets are augmented with superior flaming blades.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_item.text: The wearer of this bizarre pendant is supernaturally protected against attacks from flying creatures.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_un.text: Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the winds from whence they came.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_pro03_lor.text: The Lichemaster raises the ancient Wight to do his bidding, but Krell serves Nagash first and foremost...

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc04_uni.text: As the final battle between good and evil looms, the flagellants ready to embrace death. The time is near; the end is nigh!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_un.text: Those that look upon the Jabberslythe for too long will suffer insanity, even causing injury to themselves in desperation of escape.
A frequent gorging on the enemy’s battle lines leads to this one’s flesh flushing red as its wounds reknit themselves.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc04_spe.text: The Warrior Priest implores Sigmar to imbue him with a modicum of divine strength, and now his hammer glows bright with power!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_que.text: Any creature that gets close enough forfeits its lifeforce, which the Terrorgheist uses to bind its Unliving minions to its will.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc06_run.text: As the Runelord hammers upon the Anvil of Doom he shapes the Rune of Wrath & Ruin, causing the earth to crack and vent forth fire and sulphur.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc15_que.text: Each blow and every move only serve to make it a stronger and less-forgiving opponent.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_bann.text: The squalling wails emanating from the folds of this tattered standard recall untold horrors. Foes who hear it beg for the release of their tormented souls.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_qu.text: Each blow and every move only serve to make the Carnosaur a stronger and less-forgiving opponent.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_ch.text: Whenever Khalida awakens, the power of the Asp Goddess floods her body, infusing life and power into her mummified remains so that she may defeat her enemies.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc04_spe.text: The Wizard calls forth spectral winds that howl through the enemy ranks, tearing their souls from their bodies.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_it.text: An amulet made of a Dragon's fang is a reminder that no matter how vicious the beast, it *will* fall.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_spe.text: An invisible aura of horror surrounds the Wizard’s allies. Only the bravest foes now stand before them.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_her.text: The herd waits, allowing the enemy to come to them. Nature is their defence, as man will soon find out.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_fac.text: Slaughter! There is no greater glorification of Khaine, the God of Murder, and no more popular form of worship amongst the Dark Elves. It is through killing that Dark Elves rise above other beings. Once engulfed in enough bloodshed, they will often feel their murderous prowess increase, as if Khaine himself was guiding the blades of his disciples.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_arm.text: Using Dark Magic, the crones hurl a blood-filled cauldron at the foe from the Black Ark’s deck. Its impact is devastating, as the blood within is a foul, corrosive brew.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_uni.text: The Wardancer threads and loops, contorting to create an ethereal fabric that turns aside arrows and bolts.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: Friendly targets are filled with magical energy, making them even more aggressive!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc14_un.text: Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the Winds from whence they came.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: Green bolts of purest spite burst forth from the Shaman and streak towards the enemy.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_lore.text: Spells from the Lore of Heavens manipulate the ethers of the skies, buffeting and pummelling winged creatures.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: Zealotry is another tool to be wielded by the disciplined; an application of ardour and devotion most precisely tuned towards victory!\\n\\n[[col:magic]]This ability is being mirrored using knowledge gained from a prisoner interrogation in Athel Tamarha.[[/col]]

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_it.text: The forest’s magical berries yield an intoxicating yet rejuvenating brew, potent enough in a single acorn cup to manifest its desired effects.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_ar.text: "There… Let's see what he has to say to this 'ere pair o'beauties!"

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_spe.text: The spellcaster opens a vortex leading into the Pit. Anything caught within it will be lost forever.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_item.text: When winded, the Silver Horn sounds a clear note that brings hope to Dwarfs and foreboding doom to the enemy.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc09_it.text: These eight magical scrolls, containing the sum total of Neferra's lifetime of learning, can whip up an unstoppable hurricane of power to crush the foe.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_sp.text: Few have the strength to break free once the Kraken has them within its horrid, betentacled grasp.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc15_uni.text: Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the Winds from whence they came.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: The caster draws on unstable power from the Realm of Chaos to charge their spells.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_lor.text: When caught within radius of Todbringer, those enemies whose morale is already weak must face further penalties to their melee abilities.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_lo.text: The Bride of Khaine is a consummate murderer; as she reaps the blood, her desire for further slaughter intensifies.

unit_abilities_onscreen_name_wh2_dlc09_s.text: Ptra's Incantation of Righteous Smiting Upgraded

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_ch.text: "Now listen up and listen good, yer salty sea-dogs…"

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_cha.text: By which an unexpected shower of pointy death rains down upon the unfortunate targets. Ouch!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_item.text: The Crown of Command has been worn in countless battles. Its wearer is given great authority, instilling in his subjects an unbreakable courage.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_ite.text: Wearing the stitched hides of enemies slain through treachery is believed to attract the favour of the Horned Rat.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_ch.text: These particular balls give the shooter a magical advantage over their targets.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_lo.text: Force-feeding madness-inducing fungus brew to your minions can be advantageous but risky, with wholly unpredictable results.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: The Wizard conjures a boiling ball of magical flame and hurls it at a nearby foe.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_ch.text: They say gobbo gingivitis is the number one cause of their bad breath, but in some cases such afflictions can be appropriately weaponised!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_lo.text: Those who fall under the glare of Hellebron share her lust and rage.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc04_spe.text: The Warrior Priest’s faith manifests in the form of a shield as hard as castle-forged steel.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: Fingers of light seep into enemy armour, attacking its wearers.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_spe.text: When cast, this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_lor.text: An aura of Dark Magic conjures black darts of malice that flit through the air to pierce victims of the spellcaster’s spite.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_he.text: Loyalty is a simple concept to a Skaven Chieftain – they serve whoever values loyalty the most!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_her.text: Built with secrets stolen from the mysterious east, Warlock Engineers seek to improve the propulsion and payload of these devastating weapons.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_spe.text: The Wizard conjures a boiling ball of magical flame and hurls it at a nearby foe.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: The Wizard conjures a boiling ball of magical flame and hurls it at a nearby foe.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc14_lo.text: The Deathmaster’s Daemon-possessed Weeping Blades now appear to have a malevolent mind of their own – Snikch needs only to succumb to their influence…

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_spe.text: This spell unleashes a howling roar of such intensity that it mashes brains and bursts eyeballs.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_ru.text: This rune enhances its bearer’s awareness and quickness so that he moves more fluidly, taking faster opponents by surprise.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: Power kept within oneself can’t stay buried forever – eventually it will be released and can empower all those around.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_lor.text: Orion's wolves run with their Lord, defending his person with great savagery and scant regard for their own lives.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_her.text: The raw, corrupted hide of the Skin Wolf, scarred from its many spontaneous transmogrifications, forms a protective, armour-like layer.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_spe.text: Sounding a gnarled horn, the caster summons a glowing amber spear and hurls it at the foe with uncanny accuracy.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_spe.text: The enemies’ weapons become heavy, cumbersome, and almost impossible to wield in battle.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_item.text: When a magic-user rubs a power stone, the artefact glows for a split second before dulling forever. However, in that moment, the Winds of Magic blow a tempest!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_it.text: Thought of as a jungle-spirit made flesh, the Wanderer is treated with great deference and adorned with ceremonial tokens.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc13_lo.text: Wulfhart considers it his sworn duty to dispatch the Emperor's enemies without the slightest hesitation.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc06_cha.text: Recently, Wurrzag has taken to carrying a doll or ‘effagee’ of his foes and sticking pins in them to “stop da gitz from gettin’ away”.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_mou.text: The deafening peals toll throughout the land, driving the verminous Skaven to ever-greater heights of ferocity.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_her.text: Movement like the hawk’s - soaring, graceful, puissant; ending in your death.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: The caster calls down a mighty ball of lightning and hurls it - should the foe be struck they will surely be shattered!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc14_un.text: The pain of a shrine-bound Medusa permeates the battlefield, exuding a scent of suffering that invigorates those fighting alongside her.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_lore.text: Light Magic excels at the scourging of the supernatural, be they Daemons and creatures of Chaos, or the unquiet dead.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc12_un.text: A scorching ray of light blasts forth from the sky, putting the foe to flight or screaming, burning death - preferably the latter!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_cha.text: While Lizardmen may be slow to react due to their cold-blooded nature, this also makes them stoic in battle.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_un.text: As the Undead rip apart their victims they feast on the organs that spill forth – regaining strength in the process.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_sp.text: Drowned sailors are easily bound, for they remember their last voyage and many of their worldly duties.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc04_que.text: The Strigoi Ghoul King has the ability to resurrect his Undead servants time and time again.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_ar.text: placeholder

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_spe.text: This spell calls to the creeping things of the undergrowth, sending a swarm of spiders, centipedes, and slug-beetles onto the foe.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_her.text: The herd waits, allowing the enemy to come to them. Nature is their defence, as man will soon find out.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_spe.text: The Bray-Shaman magnifies the savage and animalistic parts of the foe's psyche until they are nothing more than growling beasts.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc04_lor.text: This Vampire Lord feints and shades, confounding their enemy into missteps and errors.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_lo.text: Gwindalor is as valuable for reconnaissance as he is for combat, sensing the most advantageous positions from which the Sisters can inflict the most harm.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc08_lor.text: There's no outrunning the terrible, flying Longship known as the 'Seafang'; once in its sights, an agonising, merciless death is your only possible destination.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: Divining auspicious signs, the caster guides the minds of targets, augmenting them with the foresight needed for victory.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_ite.text: The drum echoes the beating heart of the jungle itself. As the Lizardmen march to war, the thundering booms quicken.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_uni.text: The eldest, most powerful Dragons can destroy entire units with a molten blast of their white-hot breath.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_ite.text: Trollhide confers some of the more gruesome abilities of its former occupant to the wearer!

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: A freezing gale is conjured and sent to assail the target with ice and hail.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: Harnessing the sickly power of Shyish, the Wizard weakens the foe's will to survive the battle.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_her.text: The magical power permeating the forests is bestowed upon those who defend it.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_item.text: The sludgy black liquor in this stern glass flask is a Potion of Strength, allowing the drinker to cause devastating damage.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_un.text: This ice-cold breath delivers freezing death, slowing down those who are fortunate to survive the exposure.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_it.text: Many in the realms of men believe this powerful dampener of magic was once carried by their God of Nature, Taal himself.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: The Wizard issues a three word curse, hexing the target unit and blighting their ability to attack and defend.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc15_un.text: A special brew originally concocted by Skarsnik, the bottle is inscribed with the words of the Warlord himself – "From Eight Peaks with luv, xoxo".

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_it.text: Large iron bands wrapped around the Ironbeard's wrist to deflect enemy strikes.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_un.text: Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, eventually disappearing back to the Winds from whence they came.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: The Wizard calls upon the beneficent Guardian of Light to protect his allies from harm.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_ch.text: Scurrying over their host with feverish abandon, Netlings snag the weapons of enemies that come too close with webs of magical filaments.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_wea.text: One of twelve magical swords belonging to the Empire's Elector Counts, 'Legbiter' enables its bearer to recover more quickly if wounded.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc10_it.text: A strong, thick belt; perfect for beard-tuckers and flask-holders everywhere.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_main_spe.text: The sky opens and a bolt of burning, pure Chaos black lightning hurtles towards the foe.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_spel.text: An invisible aura of horror surrounds the Wizard’s allies. Only the bravest foes now stand before them.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_her.text: The herd charges out, slathering jaws and bellowing in fury. Against the charge, none can stand.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc16_un.text: Though the wargrove’s Elves remain under the enchanted delusion that they fight for their queen, the spell’s debilitations have been overcome.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_lor.text: A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc03_uni.text: Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the winds from whence they came.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc06_que.text: Swiftly invoking the protection of Sigmar or Ulric blesses the implorer with a shield of godly faith, should they prove worthy.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc11_lo.text: The Seafather looks after his own.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_dlc05_spe.text: The spellcaster opens a vortex leading into the Pit. Anything caught within it will be lost forever.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_lord.text: Azhag has no tolerance for infighting, when he issues an order the boyz must 'get on wiv it' or pay with a particularly grisly death.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh2_dlc17_sp.text: Creatures of the dark beware, for the Mage casts a ball of pure light to banish enemies of White Wizardry.

unit_abilities_tooltip_text_wh_main_hero.text: The Witch Hunter levels his finger across the battlefield and accuses one of the enemy of arch-heresy!
